HPI: Briefly, patient to BMH with syncope in spring 2094. Work up unremarkable including cerebrovascular imaging, cardiac cath, EP study, loop recorder. Noted to have stable CAD and is on regimen for that including ACEI, BB, ASA, Statin.
In hospital, was noted that pt had had 40 lb weight loss over previous months. Chronically elevated PSA noted. Bone scan performed was unremarkable. Right inguinal hernia noted, was repaired in October.
Pt noted to be depressed and psychotic, requiring inpt hospitalization on Psych floor. Depn successfully treated and psychosis improved as well. Has been followed by Dr. Nobles s/p d/c.
Presented to BMH in early Feb with abdominal pain, found to have bladder outlet obs from enlarged prostate leading to b/l hydronephrosis. Repeatedly failed voiding trials s/p d/c despite maximal medical therapy. Therefore, had an uncomplicated TURP. Since TURP, pt had successful voiding trial. Had been asked to continue his proscar and 2 flomax qd for another month, then stop proscar and continue with just one flomax qd after this period of time. Still taking both, however, at this time.
Seen by cardiology .Felt stable from CV perspective. Recommended lower ext ABIs/PVRs which pt declined at time. Recommended restarting ASA s/p TURP.
Mood stable. Has been only taking 3.75mg Zyprexa qd, not been taking 7.5mg as prescribed. Has been having some weight loss per hx -- however, not so upon checking of weights in LMR.
Notes that he feels weaker than usual --"weak as a kitten." Feels coincides with when he was hospitalized and meds then started.
Also notes watery eyes x few months. WOnders whether this can be due to FLomax
